channel.title: New Runescape Potions
channel.description:
These are the potions runescape released for herblore. This is including special attack restore and up. Ints are included no models needed. (I tried a new recoloring method which should work.)
http://www.mediafire.com/?f5ngtzcqxdk64s5
Example of new recoloring method:[code] if(i == 9032) // Your desired item id (the one you use after ::pickup ##### #) { class8.aStringArray189 = new String[5]; class8.aStringArray189[1] = "Drink"; // String name, this can be changed to wield, or attach, or whatever you want class8.anInt174 = 2621; // Drop/Inv Model class8.anInt181 = 800; // Zoom - Increase to make inv model smaller class8.anInt190 = 498; // Rotate up/down - Increase to rotate upwards class8.anInt198 = 1300; // Rotate right/left - Increase to rotate right class8.anInt169 = -1; // Position in inv, increase to move right class8.anInt194 = -1; // Position in inv, increase to move up class8.anIntArray156 = new int[1]; // Number of Original Colours Changed class8.anIntArray160 = new int[1]; // Number of New Model Colours Changed class8.anIntArray156[0] = 61; // Original Colour 1 class8.anIntArray160[0] = 0x3F57; // New Model Colour 1 class8.aString170 = "Super Prayer(1)"; // Item Name class8.aByteArray178 = "One dose of Super prayer potion.".getBytes(); // Item Examine }[/code] Rotation ints need to be legit kind... Sorry I don't have the time to do them.

item.title: New Runescape Potions
item.dc:creator: @the_wanderer The Wanderer
item.description:
@the_wanderer wrote:

the elve age:

All you have to do is change the brightness of the drink and call it an Extreme potion.

Not for some of the potions that had no existing potion of the likes. For example overload, special restore, and super prayer. And btw anyone test this to make sure it works? I don’t own a client anymore…

Read full topic

item.title: New Runescape Potions
item.dc:creator: @the_wanderer The Wanderer
item.description:
@the_wanderer wrote:

These are the potions runescape released for herblore. This is including special attack restore and up. Ints are included no models needed. (I tried a new recoloring method which should work.)

http://www.mediafire.com/?f5ngtzcqxdk64s5

Example of new recoloring method: if(i == 9032) // Your desired item id (the one you use after ::pickup ##### #) { class8.aStringArray189 = new String[5]; class8.aStringArray189[1] = "Drink"; // String name, this can be changed to wield, or attach, or whatever you want class8.anInt174 = 2621; // Drop/Inv Model class8.anInt181 = 800; // Zoom - Increase to make inv model smaller class8.anInt190 = 498; // Rotate up/down - Increase to rotate upwards class8.anInt198 = 1300; // Rotate right/left - Increase to rotate right class8.anInt169 = -1; // Position in inv, increase to move right class8.anInt194 = -1; // Position in inv, increase to move up class8.anIntArray156 = new int[1]; // Number of Original Colours Changed class8.anIntArray160 = new int[1]; // Number of New Model Colours Changed class8.anIntArray156[0] = 61; // Original Colour 1 class8.anIntArray160[0] = 0x3F57; // New Model Colour 1 class8.aString170 = "Super Prayer(1)"; // Item Name class8.aByteArray178 = "One dose of Super prayer potion.".getBytes(); // Item Examine }
Rotation ints need to be legit kind… Sorry I don’t have the time to do them.

Read full topic
